meanings.definition: The breakdown of a substance by exposure to light.
meanings.sent1: The photodecomposition of the plastic bottle was evident under the bright sun.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study photodecomposition to understand how light can break down materials.
meanings.sent3: The photodecomposition of the cake left in the sun made it look like modern art.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the photodecomposition of darkness, bringing light to the room.
meanings.sent5: The photodecomposition of the old photograph revealed hidden details.

meanings.definition: The process of decomposition caused by light.
meanings.sent1: We observed the photodecomposition of the leaves on the forest floor.
meanings.sent2: Photodecomposition is a natural phenomenon that occurs in various environments.
meanings.sent3: The photodecomposition of the ice cream cone left in the sun turned it into a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The artist used photodecomposition as a metaphor for the passage of time in her painting.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the garden was enhanced by the photodecomposition of the colorful flowers.
